desc: date sent and received unencrypted but encrypted over the wire i.e. in-transit
If someone is eavesdropping on that connection on the internet they would be able to read data
unecrypted file goes through an encyption process using an encryption key resulting in an encypted file
to decrypt, the process is reversed using the SAME key
if they key is compromised, you have a problem since anyone can decrypt your data
you have two keys: 1 public, 1 private. Public key can be seen by everyone on the internet
You can encrypt the file with your public key and can only be decrypted with the private key
If you encrypt with private key, it can be decrypted with a public key
You encrypt the data key to protect it so you need a master key
You can store the encrypted data key with the encypted data
data encryption takes time, you migth be able to just re-encrypt the key
Service used to create and control encyption keys
Customer Master Keys are primary resources in KMS include key id, creation date, description, key state and key material used for encrpty/decrypt
Customer Managed Keys - created by developers
AWS Managed Keys are used by AWS managed services for encryption
result of encryption performed on plaintextusing an algorithm
